remarks.para: Except for ER operations beyond 120 minutes, one may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Associated engine bleed valve is closed, and
Aircraft is not operated in known or forecast icing conditions.
Do not operate aircraft in known forecast icing conditions.
Operations into known or forecast icing conditions are prohibited.
Aircraft remains at or below FL350.

placard.para: Placard applicable switchlight located on Bleed Air Supply Module (M10259) on P5 panel "INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Notify Flight Dispatch. Flight operations may be affected.
Press applicable L ENG, or R ENG switch light on P5 panel to OFF. Verify that bar light extinguishes and OFF light illuminates.
Two procedures are provided. Perform either step A or step B.

note.para: If step A is performed the APU bleed valve cycles to close, effectively shutting off the alternate bleed source for the affected air conditioning pack. Dispatch criteria for an inoperative air conditioner must be met per item 21-51-1.

numlitem.para: Open and collar applicable circuit breaker on overhead circuit breaker panel (P11).
Lock valves in closed position as outline below.

warning.para: FAILURE TO FOLLOW MAINTENANCE MANUAL 78-31-00/201 COULD RESULT IN INJURY TO PERSONNEL AND DAMAGE TO FAN COWL, CORE COWL, FAN DUCT COWL AND THRUST REVERSER.

numlitem.para: RB211 ENGINE: Strut pressure relief door (433 LR right, 443LL left), left engine fan duct cowl, and thrust reverser.
P&W ENGINE: Core cowls (418AR left, 428AR right), right engine fan duct cowl, and thrust reverser.

note.para: See illustrations included in items 36-11-1 and 36-11-2 for clarity.

numlitem.para: Rotate manual override hex nut on pressure regulating and shutoff valve until position indicator is in CLOSE.
Rotate manual override hex nut on engine high stage bleed valve until position indicator is in CLOSE.
Close thrust reverser, fan duct cowl, core cowl, and strut pressure relief door as applicable.
